name: COMADRE - BK FACE TATS TEE
description:
A while back we printed a second version of the "face tats" tee.  It didn't really turn out the way we wanted, so we never sold any.  They've been sitting in a box in the warehouse for a couple of years.  

Now they are on sale for half price.  The image to the left is an accurate representation of the shirt you will receive. 

Black print on a white Gildan shirt.

name: COMADRE - COMADRE S/T CD
description:
1. Color Blind 1:29 
2. Cold Rain 1:51 
3. King Worm 1:55 
4. Summercide 2:29 
5. The Moon 1:40 
6. Drag Blood 3:09 
7. Must Be Nice 2:27 
8. Storyteller 3:07 
9. Hack 1:56 
10. Untitled 3:31 
11. Binge 2:15 
12. Date Night 2:54

Alright, this beast is coming into fruition. Available to preorder on Dec 1 (Nov 30th Midnight), these things are coming through in a thick gatefold with a nice 12" x 12" booklet, and 180 g vinyl. 12 new songs from Comadre, who have not released a proper full length since 2006 (although have been quite busy with a slew of other releases.) This new LP contains the song "Cold Rain" from the previous 7" single as well as 11 other songs pretty sure to impress people and throw some for a loop with their new found go-for-it attitude. Check this thing out.

name: COMADRE - SPLIT WITH TRAINWRECK DELUX DOUBLE CD
description:
TRACK LISTING:
1. 	 Comadre - Bared Teeth
2. 	 Comadre - Home Sweet Home
3. 	 Comadre - Living Like The Living Dead
4. 	 Comadre - On Our Losses And Our Tears
5. 	 Trainwreck - Camel Bucks
	
6. 	 Trainwreck - The Best Snakes Bite Back
7. 	 Trainwreck - Teeth Versus Teeth
8. 	 Trainwreck - 60 Grit
9. 	 Trainwreck - Crimes And Cadi

This is a double CD with an eight panel, fold-open, gatefold cover with Comadre contributing four tracks of their own passionate, energetic blend of mid-'90s Orchid-influenced screamo and traditional hardcore and Germany's Trainwreck providing five tracks, playing a somewhat similar style, but with a much heavier sound, set off by dark, melodic guitars.

name: BIRDS IN ROW COLECTED 12"
description:
This is a repress of "Rise of the Phoenix" 7"(VIT005) and "Cottbus" LP (VIT015) in grand full length LP fashion. This has a die-cut jacket and a printed inner sleeve in all of its layout majesty. These two records are fucking good, and this LP is even better because it is all in one remastered place. The three-piece from Laval, France is going places and rule hard. Check it out before they are gone.

12 Tracks 
Side A 
1. Among the Ashes (015) 
2. Colossus (015) 
3. Word of Astaroth (015) 
4. Ace of Fools (015) 
5. Chat Noir (015) 
6. A Kid Called Dreamer (015) 
7. Cottbus Outro (015) 
Side B 
1. The Letter (005) 
2. Die, Testosterone, Die (005) 
3. Orange Disease (005) 
4. Actus Fidei (005) 
5. Phoenix (005)

Certain parts of the world can take up to five weeks. Please be patient. It's all run by me.

Thanks for understanding!

<3 - BK

name: CEREMONY - VIOLENCE VIOLENCE 12"
description:
After a well received demo (1000 printed) and a debut 7" that sold 2,000 copies in less than a year, Ceremony gives us "Violence Violence," their 15 song debut full length. If "Ruined" was their declaration, "Violence Violence" is their first wave assault, a soundtrack to wage war. A war against everything that hardcore has stood against, but now has been co-opted into its ranks. There's no TRL song on here, there's nothing that'll be heard at a school dance. Hardcore for the hardcore.
A free digital download is included with purchase of this record.

TRACK LISTING:
01. Violence
02. Ghosts
03. Living Hell
04. My Hands Are Made Of Spite
05. Along
06. Nail
07. Bite Down
08. Cross Them Out
09. Violence
10. Clouds Of Fire
11. Pressure's On
12. Walking Home
13. Asleep

name: LEWD ACTS - BLACK EYE BLUES CD
description:
Lewd Acts' brand of raw noise reeks of true soul and stunning originality. Opting to embrace their pre-1988 punk and hardcore influences, they collectively shun metal tendencies of todays hardcore scene. Vocally crooning and sonically winding their way through each song in ways that are continuously moving and exciting.
Their latest album "Black Eye Blues" was engineered by Kurt Ballou (Converge) at God City Studios. "Black Eye Blues" shows Lewd Acts growing right before our eyes, splitting shoes as they evolve at a monstrous rate. Their razor sharp precision and dynamic instrumentation continues to reach passed punks limitations while embracing it in spirit. All of this is a vivid backdrop for vocalist Tyler Densley's poetically bruising storytelling. His gruff candor is unforgettable; Sad, tragic, and true to life. Songs like the thematic pairing "You Don't Need Me" and "I Don't Need You" are a true example of this. While the epic closer "Nowhere To Go" proves that Lewd Acts are comfortable creatively coloring outside the lines. Habitually defying the rules as they artistically redefine what is real rebellion in song.

TRACK LISTING:
01. Know Where To Go 
02. Wide Black Eyes 
03. Nightcrawlers 
04. You Don't Need Me 
05. I Don't Need You 
06. Who Knew the West Coast Could Be So Cold 
07. Penmanship Sailed 
08. Young Lovers, Old Livers 
09. Rot Gut Charlie 
10. My Father Was a Locomotive 
11. Nowhere To Go

name: COMADRE X GLASSES Double 7"
description:
BTC009/VIT009

Second pressing available now on translucent ice blue vinyl!!

Two 7" records with a 12-page booklet fixed to the inner spine of a gatefold cover. Thanks to Justin at Vitriol for sharing this release with us.

This is the second pressing of Comadre's 6th release and Glasses' 2nd, with both bands following up one-sided LPs released last year. If Comadre's "A Wolf Ticket" had been a full length, these songs would have rounded out the release. Glasses delivers the most pulverising, rock 'n' roll-ing-est hardcore that has ever been played in drop-C tuning. Thanks to Justin at Vitriol for sharing this release with us.

Track Listing:

COMADRE: the sweeter the juice; byrne'ing down the haus; count basie box set; living differently?!

GLASSES: Tigers; So Right; Lydia

name: COMADRE - A WOLF TICKET 10"
description:
BTC008/PP0043

This is the repress of Comadre's A Wolf Ticket, originally released in 2009. This brand new edition features a two-sided 10" record which plays at 45 RPMs in a tight gatefold jacket. Thanks to Vinnie at Paper + Plastick for sharing this release with us.

This is Comadre's 5th release, following 2 years after their previous release, a split CD/LP with Trainwreck (Germany). Get ready for some different shit. Comadre doesn't stray far from what you should expect from them, but they have managed to pull off there own style of emo-influenced punk rock better than before.

Out of 1,000 records pressed, the color variations are as follows:

100 x Clear w/ Tan Splatter (Sold Out) 
450 x Black in Tan (Order Here) 
450 x Black w/ Secret Splatter 

Track Listing:

Hamlets; Tannerisms; Viva Hate Pt. 1; Viva Hate Pt. 2; Word Is Bond; Grow Worms; King Jeremy; "Suicides May Have Been Pact"

name: LOMA - DARK MOUNTAIN 12"
description:
DARK MOUNTAIN 12" REPRESS

Limited to 500 copies on clear vinyl.

San Franciscos LOMA PRIETA return with a follow-up to 2008's "Last City." Never afraid to straddle genres, this album picks up where Last City left off and finds the band probing the outer limits of "post-hardcore." The album was recorded by Jack Shirley (Comadre), with additional recordings by the band, once again mixed by Jay Pellicci (31 Knots), and mastered by JJ Golden. 8 songs of blistering and beautiful hardcore. For fans of American Football and American Nightmare.

01. Exit Here
02. Vermillion River
03. King Xing
04. Carelessnessness
05. Ghost Shadow 
06. Punxx'nup 
07. Arc
08. Surrounding

name: V,HB - 7"
description: Vs, Havnted Bodies hail from the bay area of California. Home to the creative history of passionate hardcore/punk, they embody that identity and ideal to the purest points. These 4 songs are violent, chaotic, and full of rage. For fans of Tristan tzara, neil perry and louise cyphre and also Features ex and current members of loma prieta and occams razor, they sound much like the latter and present bands.

name: PUNCH  PUSH,PULL RP 12"
description:
The Bay Area mosh-bringer unit known as PUNCH delivers their second LP - chock full of 1000mph pissedness with hammers-of-justice mosh-trocious breakdowns that can get even the the longest of the long-hairs starting the mower. A great combination of good people, intelligent and insightful lyrics, and fucking full-on pissed and fast hardcore. One of the best around.

TRACK LISTING:

1. Stay Afloat 
2. Second Chance 
3. No Remorse 
4. Give It A Name 
5. White Noise 
6. Fixation 
7. Realist 

8. Sour Grapes 
9. Two Feet On The Ground 
10. Microcausm 
11. Let Me Forget 
12. Don't Need You 
13. Positively God Free

name: PUNCH -S/T 12"
description:
San Franciscos PUNCH return! This is about as good as it gets - insightful lyrics, blistering fastcore mixed with solid hardcore - with some heavy-ass breakdowns that will most definitely drop the hammers of justice. 16 songs of punishing hardcore done with heart. This IS Bay Area Hardcore. 


Track List: 
1. Don't Start 
2. Fuming 
3. Get Back 
4. Ol' Factory 
5. Right Of Way 
6. If Not Me 
7. Been Here Before

name: PUNCH EYELESS CD/EP (JAPANESE IMPORT)
description:
his is the Japanese import CD version of the "Eyeless EP" that includes all 7 songs from the vinyl record plus all of the tracks from the cassette demo. This was released by Cosmic Note records and was sold on the Punch 2009 Japanese tour.

------------

Punch is a female-fronted San Francisco punk band playing fast and dirty hardcore in the vein of RAMBO, Mouthpiece, and Rorschach. Featuring former and current members of Doppleganger, Rosenbombs, Bullets In, and Loma Prieta.

Tracklist: 
1. Thank You Come Again 
2. Nothing Left 
3. Waste Land 
4. Convenience Store 
5. Semantically Challenged 
6. No Such Things As A Stupid Question 
7. Words 
8. Semantically Challenged 
9. No Such Thing As A Stupid Question 
10. Break A Leg 
11. Thank you, Come Again 
12. Ol' factory
